docs.lead_paragraph: President Barack Obama's ban on discriminatory health insurance practices against the sick has not stopped insurers from increasing up-front charges for the expensive drugs needed to control chronic illnesses from leukemia to multiple sclerosis.

headline.main: Chronically Ill Facing High Drugs Costs Under U.S. Health Law
headline.print_headline: Chronically Ill Facing High Drugs Costs Under U.S. Health Law

docs.snippet: President Barack Obama's ban on discriminatory health insurance practices against the sick has not stopped insurers from increasing up-front charges for the expensive drugs needed to control chronic illnesses from leukemia to multiple sclerosis.

headline.main: Living With Schizophrenia: Wanting to Connect

docs.abstract: I had been happy in high school, popular even, and the ability to connect with people seemed so effortless then. It’s a goal I’ve been striving to reattain for the last eight years, since my diagnosis of schizophrenia.
docs.snippet: I had been happy in high school, popular even, and the ability to connect with people seemed so effortless then. It’s a goal I’ve been striving to reattain for the last eight years, since my diagnosis of schizophrenia.

docs.lead_paragraph: In an unusual joint paper, officials said that assertions by some researchers that the drugs could cause pancreatic inflammation were “inconsistent with the current data.”

headline.main: U.S. and European Regulators Call Popular Diabetes Drugs Safe
headline.print_headline: U.S. and European Regulators Call Popular Diabetes Drugs Safe

docs.abstract: Regulators in United States and Europe, in joint paper in The New England Journal of Medicine, say their own research and reviews of study data on some of world's most popular diabetes drugs indicates little cause for concern; some researchers said drugs could cause pancreatic inflammation.
docs.snippet: In an unusual joint paper, officials said that assertions by some researchers that the drugs could cause pancreatic inflammation were “inconsistent with the current data.”

docs.lead_paragraph: Cannabis use likely triggered fatal complications that led to the deaths of two men with underlying health conditions, according to scientists in Germany.

headline.main: German Study Finds Cannabis Use Triggered 2 Deaths
headline.print_headline: German Study Finds Cannabis Use Triggered 2 Deaths

docs.snippet: Cannabis use likely triggered fatal complications that led to the deaths of two men with underlying health conditions, according to scientists in Germany.
